Module io.inverno.mod.configuration
Package io.inverno.mod.configuration.source

Class CompositeConfigurationSource

java.lang.Object
io.inverno.mod.configuration.source.CompositeConfigurationSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationSource<CompositeConfigurationSource.CompositeConfigurationQuery,CompositeConfigurationSource.CompositeExecutableConfigurationQuery,CompositeConfigurationSource.CompositeListConfigurationQuery>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BootstrapConfigurationSource
public class CompositeConfigurationSource extends Object implements ConfigurationSource<CompositeConfigurationSource.CompositeConfigurationQuery,CompositeConfigurationSource.CompositeExecutableConfigurationQuery,CompositeConfigurationSource.CompositeListConfigurationQuery>

A composite configuration source that uses multiple configuration sources to resolve configuration properties.

A composite configuration source uses a CompositeConfigurationStrategy to determine the best matching value among the different sources for a given query.

This allows to define priorities to the configuration sources so that if two sources define a value for a given property the value of the source with the highest priority is chosen. It also allows to implement more complex resolving strategies to determine the best matching value whose key does not necessarily exactly match the query. This is especially usefull when one needs to define a base configuration and customize it based on a context given by configuration parameters.

A composite configuration source queries its sources in sequence.

At each round, the actual queries executed on the source are populated by the strategy (@see CompositeConfigurationStrategy.populateSourceQuery(io.inverno.mod.configuration.ConfigurationKey, io.inverno.mod.configuration.ConfigurationQuery, io.inverno.mod.configuration.ConfigurationKey)) so that multiple queries can actually be requested for a single original query to the composite source.

It then retains the first non-empty result that supersedes the one resolved in previous rounds for that original query (see @link CompositeConfigurationStrategy.isSuperseded(io.inverno.mod.configuration.ConfigurationKey, io.inverno.mod.configuration.ConfigurationKey, io.inverno.mod.configuration.ConfigurationKey)}.

A property value is retained and the sequence stops when the query is considered as resolved according to the strategy (see CompositeConfigurationStrategy.isResolved(io.inverno.mod.configuration.ConfigurationKey, io.inverno.mod.configuration.ConfigurationKey)) or if there's no more source to query.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Jeremy Kuhn
